headline: Lemon Zucchini Bread
description: Lemon zest adds a touch of summer to this sweet zucchini bread!

video.description: Grated zucchini, lemon zest, and cinnamon make a delicious and easy loaf of bread for breakfast or snacks!
video.name: How to Make Lemon Zucchini Bread

name: Lemon Zucchini Bread

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Grease an 8x4 inch loaf pan.

In a bowl, beat together the zucchini, sugar, egg, and oil. In a separate bowl, sift together the flour, salt, baking soda, and baking powder; stir in the cinnamon and lemon zest. Stir the flour mixture into the zucchini mixture just until blended. Pour the batter into the prepared pan.
Bake 45 minutes in the preheated oven, until a knife inserted in the center comes out clean. Remove from heat, and cool about 10 minutes before turning out onto a wire rack to cool completely.

review.reviewBody: This bread was delicious, light and fluffy. The only change I made was to add a cup of walnuts. Wonderful recipe and I'll definitely be making it again.
Easy, tasty and moist. I added walnuts for a little crunchy texture.

Delicious! Everyone loved it. The only thing I did different than the recipe is add a little lemon juice to the batter & topped it with a lemon glaze. Even if I didnâ€™t add the glaze this bread is a winner!
It is a dense bread but eats very light. I added some basil and lemon balm. I saw a bread machine recipe for herbed bread and thought this was great! I used 1-1/2c zucchini and 1/2c carrots.

Perfect! In fact, I won first place at the Morgan County Fair (Ohio) with this recipe! I followed it exactly, except I eyeballed the lemon zest, it may have been a little more or less. It did take nearly an hour to bake, but my oven is temperamental. Thank you so much for my blue ribbon!
It smell really good and look yummy ðŸ˜‹haven't given any to my hubby yet. Very easy to make.
Did a double batch. Used 1 1/2 c almond flour and monk fruit for sweetness and applesauce for the oil. Yessiree it is fabulous !!
Just made this bread & totally loved it! Because I do love me some lemon, I added an entire tablespoon of zest. The 2nd loaf I added a lemony glaze because I LOVE the flavor of that zesty lemon..

It was disappointing as it was so crumbly it fell apart when I tried to cut it. I did follow the recipe and double checked it. I believe that most of my bread/loaf recipes call for three eggs while this one only one egg and I think that is the problem.
Tasteless
Itâ€™s so good that itâ€™s gone under 10 minutes. I have to make a double batch because one isnâ€™t enough.

Very good! I made it in 2 small pans, because I didn't have the recommended size. Other changes: I used zest of a whole lemon, didn't measure, may use more next time. Used 3/4 cup of sugar, but 1/4 cup was brown sugar, remaining white sugar. Lightly sprinkled the the top with brown sugar before baking. Also, added a cream cheese icing, because I had it left over from blue berry muffins.
This recipe is awesome - may have added a bit extra zucchini and lots of zest.. slightly less sugar... voila! Amazing!
I didn't make any changes, and it was my favorite of the three zucchini bread recipes that I used today. Delicious!
I added Pecans . Yumm

I love this bread, but because of dietary issues, made some of the same changes as others. All whole-wheat flour makes for a denser bread, but my diabetic hubby can eat it. Changed out the white sugar for dark brown, and added in the juice of one of my lemons. Extra cinnamon, because cinnamon. I know there are those out there who scold for changing a recipe and rating it. Sorry. I use this site for inspiration, not as the police. I think if you need to follow recipes to the letter, great. I have been cooking for over 55 years, and always make changes, but give credit to those who inspire me.
This is delicious. A keeper.

Wonderful Zucchini Bread! I read through the other bakers comments. So used several to create my version. First I doubled the recipe because one is never enough and someone in household doesn't like walnuts-I do. Then in addition to the lemon zest I also added 2 tablespoons of lemon juice. I also added a bit of real vanilla extract, because it is so strong, only a bit is necessary. Oh! My goodness can you smell the lemon! Even when it's cold the aroma is so good, go ahead have another slice!

Delicious! I followed naples34102's advice and topped it with a lemon-sugar glaze. I also decreased the sugar to 1/2 cup. Lastly, I assembled by mixing the wet ingredients, then the zucchini, then the dry ingredients.
As with most Internet wonderful recipesâ€¦.a huge bust. No taste and No lemon taste. I will go back to old reliable recipes and leave the new improved to those without taste buds.

Good zucchini bread. It's easier to add the shredded zucchinis after beating the egg, sugar and oil. I used a little less sugar than called for. Also, I wanted more of the lemon flavor so I skipped the cinnamon, doubled the lemon zest and added 2 Tablespoon lemon juice.
Followed it but made muffins instead!! So delish....mmm lemon zest!
Fantastic recipe as is...if you like more lemony flavor, add more zest like I did...if you like a little sweetness add the lemon glaze to it like I did...yum!
just made this recipe I have yellow squash so that's what I used instead of zucchini. I didn't have a lemon so I used lemon extract perfection
Loved it â€¦.trebled the recipe .
I found it a little too salty and somewhat oily. Otherwise, the flavor was good. It did take a little longer to bake than detailed in the recipe.

This was the biggest hit ever! The bread was light tasting and so moist. Everyone loved it and it had less than half the calories of our usual zucchini bread. This will be my new go-to zucchini bread recipe!
I loved this recipe. The lemon really jazzed it up.
It was excellent and for me, the perfect amount of lemon!!
I followed the recipe to the letter. It was delicious, the lemon was a great addition! The next time I make it, I will add some chopped walnuts. Definitely a keeper!
Didn't rise or cook properly.
Moist and delicious! I actually didnâ€™t have a lemon so I put lime zest in and it worked too!

I made it with lemon extract & reduced the amount in half. I added carrots & used apple sauce. I didn't love it. it was chewy but not as moist as Im use to for zucchini bread. I also think the lemon extract wasnt the right fit. Im goign to try it again with oil instead of applesauce, no carrots, & lemon juice and add the glaze. many have recommended
Absolutely delicious!!

This recipe is divine!! I doubled the recipe for two loaves - they were a little short but insanely delicious. For the two loaves I used the zest of a whole lemon, and only mixed in the zucchini after the egg/sugar/oil were combined. Will make again and again, it is SO good I can't say enough positive things about it.
I used yellow summer squash because thatâ€™s what I had, and some lemon juice just to boost the lemon flavor. It was very tasty and a definite hit with the family.

I was looking for a simple zucchini bread recipe that only made one loaf. I love lemon so I decided to give it a try. It was easy to make and very good. The lemon zest is subtle but added that special something to the bread. I highly recommend it!

I maybe made a mistake using frozen zucchini that should have been better drained but my loaf came out extremely "wet" and didn't really raise well. I will try this again as I usually have good success with zucchini bread recipes. The lemon was really good flavor!
I love lemon, but this was just ok. Left a really weird aftertaste.
This was my first zucchini bread to make. It did not disappoint. Amazing.
I made it is so divine my family loved it i have to double the recipe next time ??, the lemon zest made a great aroma in the bread thank you for sharing this recipe.

Quick and easy! After stirring the zucchini, oil, eggs and sugar together, 
I added everything else but the flour. Stirred in the flour afterwards. I added 1/2 t. Vanilla and 1 t. lemon juice to this recipe. Delicious!
The lemon zest and cinnamon was a nice tough to this recipe. It was moist and we loved that slight lemon twist.
I used lemon juice instead of zest. And I used sea salt instead of regular salt.

Loved this recipe and seems very flexible. I used 1/2 whole wheat flour, a shredded carrot, only 1/4 c sugar and subbed apple sauce for the oil. Came out fantastic. Oh and made a glaze as other reviewers suggested which added sweetness since I cut most of the sugar in the bread. Next time going to try subbing the sugar with agave, honey or maple syrup and a flax egg for the egg to make it vegan and definitely more lemon and maybe blueberries. The possibilities are endless!
Swapped out oil with coconut oil, and the flour with 100% whole wheat. Omitted the cinnamon. Delicious!
So easy! Tastes more like cake than bread, probably due to the cinnamon
Delicious. Appreciated a bit less sugar! It was moist with just a touch of lemon. Perfect!

Itâ€™s almost exactly the same recipe as my regular zucchini bread I have been making since 1985.. That recipe comes from Better Homes and Garden cookbook. The only difference is mine calls for nutmeg. But I think if nutmeg was added to lemon one, it would over power it. 
I did add 1 tsp of fresh lemon juice and I used applesauce, 1 snack cup.
Itâ€™s delicious!!

I actually made this recipe as it is but also used it to make zucchini muffins substituting grated fresh ginger for the lemon zest (making it non longer lemon zucchini bread but whatever). Both versions turned out great!

I made this lemon zucchini bread today. I didn't use the lemon zest but used 2 tablespoons of lemon juice. I increased the baking powder to 1/2 teaspoon. I increased the oven temperature to 350 degrees. I baked them in three small bread pans instead of one large bread pan. They turned out beautifully! I do plan on putting the lemon juice powdered sugar glaze on top before serving

I followed the recipe to a T. 
Awful. Like a brick. Batter was way too thick and took a lot longer than 45 min. Almost as if something was missing
This is delicious! I used Truvia instead of sugar, no problem. I doubled the recipe and used my divided pan to bake 4 half-loaves! Maybe it will last longer that way!
Tweaked according to options, review suggestions, plus a couple personal prefs. Fabulous result. Yes, the lemon flavor was very mild, but more obvious after chilling. Marked KEEPER in my file.
Easy recipe! I doubled the dose and giving one to my son and his family! The zucchini was from our garden! So good, on a Sunday morning before church!!

I love this recipe, it was really delightful with a hint of lemon (I did add 1Tbsp of lemon juice to the batter to amp it up a bit). I also took the advice about making a lemon glaze for it which my husband LOVED, and he's not a lemon fan! The bread was moist and amazing. This is a keeper for me, thank you!!
1 1/2 teaspoons of lemon zest simply doesn't provide enough lemon to call this any kind of lemon bread. It didn't provide enough lemon to give it any lemon flavor at all.
This is light and moist. I made only two changes. Ireduced the sugar by 1/4 cup and added 1/2 teaspoon lemon oil. So good!
I made this for the first time and substituted coconut oil for the vegetable oil and it turned out delicious.

This was great! Nice lemony, warm-spiced flavor. All I changed was subbing half the oil for cinnamon applesauce, putting in a touch more cinnamon, and using lemon-flavored Greek yogurt (with some milk to yield the traditional yogurt texture). I also did as another reviewer suggested and made a glaze with lemon juice and white sugar melted on the stove. I may have waited until the bread was too cool as it didnâ€™t absorb very well and I had a ton of extra glaze. But since life handed me extra lemon glaze, I made lemonade! Just added water and ice cubes and stirred. Best lemonade ever. Happy baking (and beverage-mixing)!

I doubled the recipe since I wanted to make 2 loaves but then there was so much I ended up using a bundt pan.
I thought it was pretty good, it was moist and I had no problem with it rising. although my husband wasn't as crazy about it.
However, I did what a few other reviewers did and added a lemon glaze and it was too much lemon! I think that's what my husband didn't like. I'll try again next time but leave out the glaze and just make one loaf.

Very good...light and delicate. A nice change from the traditional zucchini bread. I wanted it to be a larger loaf so I added a little bit to each ingredient. I also made the light glaze mentioned by many reviewers, it was a nice touch yet I'm not so sure it is necessary. The glaze had such a light flavor that I bet the bread would taste the same without it. At any rate, I will make this recipe again.

I made it as a welcome a new neighbor so I can't rightly say much othe than it was easy and it looked tasty. Oh, and they neighbor left a thankyou note- so I'm guessing it wasn't awful- but who knows!

Wonderful flavor - husband loved it - even better on day two, doubt it will last to day three. Did have to bake longer than called for - pretty dense. Do add walnuts - can't wait to bring to a party or pot luck!
I doubled the recipe and added the juice of the zested lemon and it turned out perfectly. Family devoured it and loved the extra lemon!
love this recipe...cut back the sugar a bit but otherwise, all good.

I made this according to the recipe using Smude Sunflower oil for the oil ingredient. We enjoyed this recipe and found it to be very moist. The delicate flavor of the lemon was a new enjoyment for us. I will make it again.

I followed the recipe with the one suggestion to add vanilla. I couldn't decide whether I was supposed to fine grate the zucchini or regular so I did half and half. It did have a nice crisp crust. I would try again and maybe try the applesauce recommendation

This was moist and delicious! I loved the lemon in it; it added a little kick to the zucchini bread!
I will keep this recipe for ever!!
I didn't make any changes and would definitely make again!

I've made this several times altering the recipe to make lemon-blueberry zucchini bread. I substitute vanilla for the cinnamon and add about 3/4 cup blueberries. I top it with a lemon glaze made from powdered sugar and lemon juice. It makes a great summer dessert!
My kids loved this. It has such a pleasant hint of lemon. Next time Iâ€™d make a glaze for it
I made this with the only change of using 1/2 a cup of brown sugar and it was amazing, so moist . Very good and super simple. definitely will make many times.
I make lemon glaze. Definitely delicious
wonderful I made with a GF flour mix and decreased oil by 1/2, added 1 tsp ea soda and pdr, 2 C zucc, 2 eggs, lots of lemon zest, baked 45" at 335. yummy with great texture! thank you

I added shredded coconut and some pepitas (pumpkin seeds) for added texture and because I had them on hand. This recipe is moist and delicious - the office loved it so much I have to bring it back for Christmas luncheon.

This was a lovely change from banana bread but because I had to switch out the flour for a gluten free blend, it makes it a little drier. I will need to play around with the recipe to make it more moist but overall, I kept the ingredients the same and will definitely try it again.
The lemon zest truly made the zucchini pop and taste fresh. I substituted applesauce for some of the oil and sugar. Wonderfully moist.
No
I would add more lemon next time just because I like it more lemony ?? it was yummy!!

This was good. Doubled the recipe. Made the Lemon Glaze as suggested but probably would make a streusel topping instead next time. These are very moist and dense and the glaze adds to that texture a bit, although tasty. I used less sugar. I used a green zucchini and a yellow zucchini squash. For regular MUFFINS these need to bake 23 minutes. 20 was undercooked.
Delicious!!!!
Baked in mini loaf pans, quadrupled recipe.

I added 2 teaspoons of lemon juice 
Was delicious
I've now made this twice.. just added an extra 1/2 cup of zucchini and increased the bake time... delicious and moist!
Excellent flavor I will make it again for sure
Added a tablespoon of real lemon juice
This is a great recioe - for fun I like to add 1 1/2 cups of blueberrys and bake in a bunt pan. So fast, easy and delishous!
Delicious! Not too sweet and moist.
This is a great change to the normal Zucchini bread! Loved it!
This bread is so good! I did the normal recipe and was really good! I wanted to add chocolate chips and was wondering how many chocolate chips I should add?
Didn't use as much sugar as the recipe called for. It was very good. Will make it again
The best zucchini bread Iâ€™ve ever tasted. The lemon zest gives a suttle flavore that brings this recipe over the edge Thumbs up.
Very good! Moist, sweet and the lemon gives it a slightly diff spin on the usual zucchini bread. Thanks for sharing your recipe!

This was great! I never have added lemon to zucchini bread I doubled the recipe to make two loaves. One loaf to eat and one to give. I will definitely make again . i did add some vanilla and made the glaze one of the reviewers had suggested. It probably would have been fine without the glaze but I love lemon.. The bread was very moist. Needless to say it didnt last long.
I Didnâ€™t make any changes. It was perfect. Iâ€™ll be using this recipe again.
my family LOVED THIS Zucchini Bread.
This was very good. I fallowed another reviewers advice and topped it with a lemon glaze, it was good but it didn't need it and next time I won't add the glaze.
Super moist and nice flavor. Used another reviewers suggestion of adding a glaze to the top. Nice touch. Will make again.
